Docs.summary: Represents a that can process X.509 certificate reference types.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

Docs.param: An XML reader positioned at the start element of the key identifier clause.
Docs.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether the specified reader is positioned at an element.
Docs.returns: if the reader is referring to an element; otherwise, .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance bool CanWriteKeyIdentifierClause(class System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause securityKeyIdentifierClause) cil managed

Docs.param: The key identifier clause to check.
Docs.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether the specified key identifier clause can be serialized by this handler.
Docs.returns: if the key identifier clause is supported by this handler; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The supported key identifier clause types are:
1. <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509IssuerSerialKeyIdentifierClause>
2. <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509RawDataKeyIdentifierClause>
3. <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SubjectKeyIdentifierClause>

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause ReadKeyIdentifierClause(class System.Xml.XmlReader reader) cil managed

Docs.param: An XML reader positioned at the start element of the key identifier clause to read.
Docs.summary: Deserializes a key identifier clause from XML by using the specified XML reader.
Docs.returns: The key identifier clause that was deserialized from the XML or if a key identifier clause could not be read.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The ReadKeyIdentifierClause method reads `<ds:X509IssuerSerial>`, `<ds:X509SKI>`, and `<ds:X509Certificate>` elements and returns the first one found as a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509IssuerSerialKeyIdentifierClause>, a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SubjectKeyIdentifierClause>, or a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509RawDataKeyIdentifierClause>. If one of these elements is not found under the `<ds:X509Data>` element, the method returns `null`.

Docs.exception: is not positioned at a element. (The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509DataSecurityKeyIdentifierClauseSerializer.CanReadKeyIdentifierClause%2A> method returns .)

MemberSignature.Value: public override void WriteKeyIdentifierClause (System.Xml.XmlWriter writer, System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause securityKeyIdentifierClause);

.method public hidebysig virtual instance void WriteKeyIdentifierClause(class System.Xml.XmlWriter writer, class System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause securityKeyIdentifierClause) cil managed

Docs.param: The XML writer to use to serialize the key identifier clause.
The key identifier clause to serialize.
Docs.summary: Serializes the specified key identifier clause.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The supported key identifier clause types are:
1. <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509IssuerSerialKeyIdentifierClause>
2. <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509RawDataKeyIdentifierClause>
3. <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SubjectKeyIdentifierClause>

Docs.exception: is not a supported clause type.
